Apple___Apple_scab.description: Apple scab is a fungal disease causing dark, scabby lesions on apple leaves and fruit.
Apple___Apple_scab.remedy: Apply fungicides such as captan or myclobutanil. Remove and destroy fallen leaves.
Apple___Apple_scab.organic_remedy: Use sulfur-based sprays and encourage good air circulation by proper pruning.

Apple___Black_rot.description: Black rot affects apples causing fruit rot, leaf spots, and limb cankers.
Apple___Black_rot.remedy: Prune infected limbs, apply fungicides like thiophanate-methyl, and remove infected fruit.
Apple___Black_rot.organic_remedy: Spray copper-based fungicides and ensure trees are not stressed.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.description: Cedar apple rust is a fungal disease causing orange spots on apple leaves and fruit.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.remedy: Remove nearby cedar hosts, apply fungicides such as myclobutanil.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.organic_remedy: Use neem oil or sulfur sprays during early leaf development.

Apple___healthy.description: The apple plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Apple___healthy.organic_remedy: Maintain good care practices to prevent future diseases.

Blueberry___healthy.description: The blueberry plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Blueberry___healthy.organic_remedy: Regular watering and mulching will maintain plant health.

Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.description: Powdery mildew causes a white powdery coating on leaves, stems, and fruit.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.remedy: Apply fungicides containing sulfur or potassium bicarbonate.
Cherry_(including_sour)___Powdery_mildew.organic_remedy: Use baking soda spray or neem oil applications.

Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.description: The cherry plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Cherry_(including_sour)___healthy.organic_remedy: Maintain proper sunlight and airflow to prevent diseases.

Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.description: Gray leaf spot is a fungal disease causing small, rectangular gray lesions on maize leaves.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.remedy: Use fungicides like azoxystrobin and plant resistant hybrids.
Corn_(maize)___Cercospora_leaf_spot Gray.organic_remedy: Rotate crops and ensure good field hygiene.

Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.description: Common rust causes reddish-brown pustules on maize leaves.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.remedy: Apply fungicides if infection is severe; use resistant varieties.
Corn_(maize)___Common_rust_.organic_remedy: Encourage air circulation and avoid overhead irrigation.

Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.description: Northern leaf blight causes large cigar-shaped lesions on maize leaves.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.remedy: Use fungicides like strobilurins and resistant hybrids.
Corn_(maize)___Northern_Leaf_Blight.organic_remedy: Rotate crops and remove crop debris after harvest.

Corn_(maize)___healthy.description: The corn plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Corn_(maize)___healthy.organic_remedy: Proper soil management keeps corn plants strong.

Grape___Black_rot.description: Black rot affects grapes with dark, sunken lesions and fruit rot.
Grape___Black_rot.remedy: Prune and destroy infected parts, use fungicides like mancozeb.
Grape___Black_rot.organic_remedy: Apply sulfur sprays and maintain vine airflow.

Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).description: Esca, or black measles, causes discolored leaves and shriveled grapes.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).remedy: Remove infected vines and avoid injuries during pruning.
Grape___Esca_(Black_Measles).organic_remedy: Apply organic biocontrol agents and compost teas.

Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.description: Leaf blight causes brown spots with yellow margins on grape leaves.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.remedy: Apply copper-based fungicides and remove fallen leaves.
Grape___Leaf_blight_(Isariopsis_Leaf_Spo.organic_remedy: Use neem oil and improve vineyard ventilation.

Grape___healthy.description: The grapevine is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Grape___healthy.organic_remedy: Maintain proper pruning and avoid water stress.

Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).description: Citrus greening is a bacterial disease causing yellow shoots and misshapen fruit.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).remedy: There is no cure; remove and destroy infected trees.
Orange___Haunglongbing_(Citrus_greening).organic_remedy: Control psyllid insects organically and maintain tree health.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot causes dark, sunken spots on peach fruits and leaves.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.remedy: Apply copper sprays during dormant and growing seasons.
Peach___Bacterial_spot.organic_remedy: Use compost teas and maintain tree vigor.

Peach___healthy.description: The peach tree is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Peach___healthy.organic_remedy: Regular pruning and sanitation keeps peach trees healthy.

Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot causes small, water-soaked lesions on pepper leaves and fruit.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.remedy: Use copper-based bactericides and resistant varieties.
Pepper,_bell___Bacterial_spot.organic_remedy: Spray neem oil and ensure good drainage.

Pepper,_bell___healthy.description: The bell pepper plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.

Potato___Early_blight.description: Early blight causes dark brown spots with concentric rings on potato leaves.
Potato___Early_blight.remedy: Use fungicides containing chlorothalonil and rotate crops annually.
Potato___Early_blight.organic_remedy: Apply neem oil and ensure proper plant spacing.

Potato___Late_blight.description: Late blight rapidly kills leaves and causes dark lesions on stems and tubers.
Potato___Late_blight.remedy: Destroy infected plants and apply protective fungicides.
Potato___Late_blight.organic_remedy: Use copper sprays and plant resistant varieties.

Potato___healthy.description: The potato plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Potato___healthy.organic_remedy: Mulch well and avoid water splashing onto leaves.

Raspberry___healthy.description: The raspberry plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.

Soybean___healthy.description: The soybean plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Soybean___healthy.organic_remedy: Rotate crops to maintain healthy soil.

Squash___Powdery_mildew.description: Powdery mildew causes a white powdery fungal growth on squash leaves.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.remedy: Apply fungicides like sulfur or potassium bicarbonate.
Squash___Powdery_mildew.organic_remedy: Use milk sprays (1:9 milk:water) or neem oil.

Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.description: Leaf scorch causes small purple spots that expand into larger dead areas on strawberry leaves.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.remedy: Apply appropriate fungicides and remove infected leaves.
Strawberry___Leaf_scorch.organic_remedy: Use compost teas and ensure good watering practices.

Strawberry___healthy.description: The strawberry plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Strawberry___healthy.organic_remedy: Mulch and maintain plant health naturally.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.description: Bacterial spot causes small, dark, greasy lesions on tomato leaves and fruit.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.remedy: Apply copper-based bactericides and remove infected plants.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.organic_remedy: Use neem oil sprays and avoid overhead irrigation.

Tomato___Early_blight.description: Early blight causes target-like spots on lower tomato leaves, leading to defoliation.
Tomato___Early_blight.remedy: Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
Tomato___Early_blight.organic_remedy: Use compost tea sprays and improve soil drainage.

Tomato___Late_blight.description: Late blight affects tomato plants with dark water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit.
Tomato___Late_blight.remedy: Remove infected plants and use protective fungicides.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.description: Leaf mold causes yellow spots on the upper leaf surface and a fuzzy mold underneath.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.remedy: Use fungicides like mancozeb and improve air circulation.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.organic_remedy: Apply potassium bicarbonate or neem oil.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.description: Septoria leaf spot causes numerous small dark spots on lower leaves of tomato plants.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.remedy: Use fungicides containing chlorothalonil and remove infected leaves.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.organic_remedy: Spray neem oil and mulch around plants.

Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.description: Spider mites cause yellow stippling and webbing on tomato leaves.
Tomato___Spider_mites Two-spotted_spider.organic_remedy: Spray neem oil and introduce predatory mites.

Tomato___Target_Spot.description: Target spot causes brown lesions with concentric rings on tomato leaves.
Tomato___Target_Spot.organic_remedy: Use compost teas and ensure good airflow.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.description: TYLCV causes leaf curling, stunted growth, and reduced yields in tomatoes.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.remedy: Remove infected plants and control whiteflies.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.organic_remedy: Use neem oil and reflective mulches.

Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.description: Tomato mosaic virus causes mottled light and dark green patterns on tomato leaves.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.remedy: Remove infected plants; there is no chemical cure.
Tomato___Tomato_mosaic_virus.organic_remedy: Disinfect tools and wash hands before handling plants.

Tomato___healthy.description: The tomato plant is healthy and shows no signs of disease.
Tomato___healthy.organic_remedy: Maintain healthy soil and regular inspections.
